Summary My personal interest is in "Purposeful Design." I think that if done well, design can evoke a strong reaction to help people learn, think & feel. I want to combine traditional and digital mediums using multiple styles & techniques to create digital work that feels natural and thoughtful.  
 
I'm highly interested in print and magazine design, and learning to be a web & UI/UX designer to expand my design career.

Summary http://www.vcaportfolio.com/ 
 
I am a front-end digital graphic designer specializing in on-line advertising, marketing strategies, and cross-platform UX design. I have been working in the design industry, professionally, for 14 years and have had extensive involvement in brand and campaign management.  
 
I have executed campaigns from concept to implementation for high-end commercial brands while working for Yahoo! Inc. In my last full calendar year with the Yahoo Creative Solutions Team we handled roughly 802 requests, both live and pre-sales campaigns, and averaged 3.23 new projects per day, 541 of which went live on Yahoo totaling $75,824,770 in ad revenue and contributing to $1,077,610,525 in total campaign revenue for the company. 
 
The company P&G is one of Yahoo’s most trafficked clients across multiple properties and brought in approximately $69 million in campaign revenue’s. 45% of the projects that I launched that year help contribute directly to the campaign revenue total.  
 
I have a solid reputation for client satisfaction not only with my design aesthetic but also with my customer service skills. I provide a complete and professional working experience that is user and client focused. Summary http://www.vcaportfolio.com/

My portfolio of work can be viewed at: www.designbyvictorialee.com

Summary I am a visual designer professional specializing in calligraphy, lettering, and type design. My calligraphy projects for themed environments are done with regards to history of writing which determines the appropriate choice of tools, substrates, and lettering styles that help tell the story accurately. The deliverables include props, signs, hand-written letters, signatures, fine arts, logos, and fonts. 
 
Having had training in Industrial Design within the School of Architecture, I am able to visualize and create three dimensional graphics in real world environment such as exhibitions and theme parks with knowledge of materials, constructions, and installations. My wide range of skills and experience also allows me to apply visual designs to various applications from print collateral to web development and environmental graphic design. 
 
Currently, I hold permanent residency of the United States and have a full legal status to work in the U.S. and Thailand. Summary I am currently the Senior Marketing Associate - Graphic Designer for the New England Area for Cushman & Wakefield, the world’s largest privately-held commercial real estate services firm with operations in 60 countries. I am responsible for the design and production of a wide range of print and multi-media products in support of the marketing of over 50 million square feet of commercial real estate properties in New England. Working closely with key decision makers, marketing directors and brokers, I was the principle graphic designer for one of the top performing regions for the company. 
 
Prior to this I was the Senior Graphic Designer at Libera Design, a prestigious design agency in Los Angeles specializing in annual reports and corporate identity. I was the lead designer creating the annual reports for Sanmia-SCI, DDi, Cirrus Logic, Hall Kinion, Pac West and Zoran.  
 
I also have had extensive freelance design experience including clients such as Bank of America, Hasbro, Connecticut Public Television, Channing-Bete and UCLA Extension. Experience Graphic Designer UCLA Athletic Hall of Fame July 2014  – Present (1 year 2 months) Los Angeles, CA Working in the UCLA Athletic Hall of Fame, I design, mount, and install graphics for all of the display cases exhibiting our 21 sports teams, past and present professional athletes, and collection of national recognitions. I coordinate with athletic directors and personnel on a daily basis to complete vinyl and print projects within the Hall of Fame building, as well as training facilities across campus. I managed all sports updates for the past year, compiling team statistics, photos, and rosters every season to maintain the most recent information about our athletes and team schedules.  
 
But the best part of working for the athletics department boasting the greatest number of national championships in the country is that I get to be an integral part of the Bruin family, printing our accomplishments into history and displaying our impressive athletic portfolio for the hundreds of fans who pass through the Hall of Fame every day. And through the work of our senior curator and design team, I hope all visitors to the Hall of Fame take away one core ideal: CHAMPIONS MADE HERE. Research Assistant UCLA Health | Department of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry April 2014  – Present (1 year 5 months) Los Angeles, CA I currently volunteer in a psychology research lab that tests the effectiveness of various medications and treatment methods in pediatric and adult autism spectrum disorder and ADHD participants. I learned to collect vital signs and process blood samples from the participants while gaining a greater understanding of the research process through preparing weekly study visits and organizing test results and data. I was able to interact more personally with the children who came into the lab by initiating play sessions using coloring books and toy soldiers.  
 
I also had the opportunity to contribute my graphic design skills by redesigning and restructuring the group's website page to increase accessibility of important study details and information for prospective participants. Furthermore, I designed flyers and recruitment materials used in print and online advertisements aimed at increasing exposure of our research studies in affiliated and target communities. Graphic Designer Top Baguette June 2013  –  September 2013  (4 months) Top Baguette reigns as one of the most highly reviewed banh mi shops in the Orange County area. With it's most recent relocation and interior renovation, I was recruited to help rebrand the growing business. To appeal to a younger customer base, I aimed to create a fun and modernized identity that would set Top Baguette apart from it's more traditionally Vietnamese counterparts. I drew upon the bright colors used within the interior of the shop to create the new logo, menu, and business card designs. To further solidify its identity, I launched a complementary Wordpress website for the business to gain new customers and curated content for an in-store display of the shop's most recent awards and recognitions. If you're ever in the area and are craving a bite to eat, be sure to check them out! With it's most recent relocation and interior renovation, I was recruited to help rebrand the growing business. To appeal to a younger customer base, I aimed to create a fun and modernized identity that would set Top Baguette apart from it's more traditionally Vietnamese counterparts. I drew upon the bright colors used within the interior of the shop to create the new logo, menu, and business card designs. To further solidify its identity, I launched a complementary Wordpress website for the business to gain new customers and curated content for an in-store display of the shop's most recent awards and recognitions. If you're ever in the area and are craving a bite to eat, be sure to check them out!
